alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 4:29PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WATER POSSIBLE ALONG THE NORTH SHORE OF KUSKOKWIM BAY SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY... A powerful storm system moving into the Bering Sea this weekend will cause a prolonged period of gale to storm force winds (35 to 55 kt) over the eastern Bering Sea and Southwest Alaska coast. For the north coast of Kuskokwim Bay (including Kwigillingok), sea ice will compact against the coastline and some will melt due to warmer temperatures and the wind and wave action. Water may push up through the ice and onshore during high tides, leading to water levels above normal highest tides. While higher than normal water levels are possible, it seems unlikely that water levels would get high enough to cause flooding in coastal communities.
